extraction_metadata.notes: Trial of Nicolas Pairson, male herdsman accused primarily of causing animal deaths and human illnesses/deaths through witchcraft. Notable for: (1) extensive testimony about threats following quarrels, especially regarding Mr d'Etival's death; (2) economic disputes central to accusations (debts, wages, customary payments); (3) domestic violence context (wife repeatedly fled, called him witch); (4) mother previously executed as witch; (5) confessed before torture was applied; (6) named 5 accomplices at sabbat; (7) wolf predation on livestock attributed to his witchcraft as herdsman; (8) prior imprisonment for theft. 27 witnesses testified.
